meta.name: generator
meta.content: HTML Tidy for Windows (vers 25 March 2009), see www.w3.org

head.title: ElectricFlow Plugin for VMware vCenter Lab Manager

div.p: Plugin Version @PLUGIN_VERSION@
July 1, 2015

VMware vCenter Lab Manager is a software development and testing tool that enables application owners, development, and QA teams to pool network and storage resources. Lab Manager provides users with a fully equipped data center, facilitating collaboration among individuals using diverse operating platforms and facilities.

The main purpose of VMware Lab Manager is to simplify and streamline the process of gathering and interconnecting machines, installing and maintaining operating systems, adding and updating applications and resolving problems such as software bugs. VMware vCenter Lab Manager supports open, continuous communication among members and subgroups within a large, diverse development team. Users can deploy, capture, and share multi-tier application environments in seconds while IT remains in administrative control.

Lab Manager supports VMware Infrastructure 3, a software suite designed to centralize and optimize desktop management and data center resources through virtualization. VMware vCenter Lab Manager saves time and enables unique live snapshot/rollback functionality for purpose-built dev/test environments.
More information can be found at VMware website.
Check the SOAP API guide at VMware LabManager.
div.h2: ElectricFlow Integration to VMware vCenter Lab Manager
div.p: EC-LabManager integration uses the Lab Manager SOAP application programming interface (API) which provides access to the Lab Manager system. By using this secure API, the integration can connect to the Lab Manager server to automate and perform various operations providing a more generic interface for executing Lab Manager API commands and managing resources.
The plugin interact with Lab Manager data using PERL to perform the following tasks:

ul.li: Create configuration to hold connection information.
Query for virtual machine and configuration information.
Perform actions on machines and configurations.
Capture, checkout, clone, delete, and deploy configurations.
Create ElectricFlow resources.

div.p: This plugin provides two primary actions: Provision and Cleanup, which work as a pair within a job.
This plugin was developed and tested against VMware vCenter Lab Manager versions 3.0 and 4.0
ElectricFlow minimum version 4.0
IMPORTANT: For all parameter descriptions below, required parameters are shown in bold italics.

Plugin configurations are sets of parameters that apply across some or all of the plugin's procedures. They are intended to reduce repetition of common values, create predefined sets of parameters for end users, and to securely store credentials where needed. Each configuration is given a unique name that is entered in designated parameters on procedures that use them.
Plugin configurations are created by going to the Electric Commander "Administration" tab, then to the "Plugins" sub-tab. On the right side of the line for the EC-LabManager plugin, there is a "Configure" link which will open the Configuration page.

tr.td: Provide a unique name for the connection, keeping in mind that you may need to create additional connections over time. (Required)
Hostname or IP address of the Lab Manager server. (Required)
VMware vCenter Lab Manager account username/password. This account must have enough privileges to perform API functions. (Required)
Attempt a connection to the server to check the provided credentials. (Required)
Provide the debug level for the output: 0=errors only, 1=normal headers and responses, 2+=debugging information included. (Required)
Provide the timeout in seconds for each soap call. (Required)

div.p:
This procedure allows users to provision a new configuration using the VMWare Lab Manager API. Run this procedure to create and deploy a new Lab Manager configuration and create resources for machines in the new configuration.
The plugin will set properties on the ElectricFlow server using the values from "Results location" and "Provision tag". Users can set the location where they want properties to be stored by specifying the "Results location" field, if this field is blank, the default location in the job is used: /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs. When this procedure is executed, properties will be stored in "Results location"/"Provision tag". If "Create resources?" is checked, the resources will use the "Commander Workspace" and will be assigned to "Resource Pool(s)", If it is unchecked "Resource Pool(s)" and "Commander Workspace" will be ignored.
IMPORTANT: This procedure is intended to run on Lab Manager 3.5 or earlier ONLY. See procedure: Provision4.0

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration. (Required)
The name of the Organization in LabManager. This must reference an existing Organization in Lab Manager.
The workspace within Lab Manager (required in Lab Manager 4.0 and newer). This must reference an existing Workspace in Lab Manager (default is Main).
A configuration in the Lab Manager library. Provide the name of an existing configuration. (Required)
The name to use for the newly checked out configuration. If blank a name will be automatically created.
Set the state of the configuration to public or private.
Name or ID of the physical network to be used.

Network deployment option for VMs.(Required)
Options:
None
Fenced - Block IN and OUT
Fenced - Allow OUT
Fenced - Allow IN and OUT
Bridged
Create resources for machines in the configuration. If checked, this creates the resource on the ElectricFlow server. (Required)
The ElectricFlow workspace the resource should use.
The ElectricFlow resource pool names to be associated with the machines in this configuration if resources are created.
The ElectricFlow location to store properties (default is /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs).
The unique tag for this provision to keep it separate from other provisions stored in the same results area (default is $[jobStepId]). (Required)
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.

div.p:
This procedure has the same functionality as the Provision procedure (Allows users to provision a new configuration using the VMWare Lab Manager API), but Provision4.0 also allows you to specify a subset of VMs to deploy. Because this feature was implemented in LabManager 4.0, this procedure is not available for earlier LabManager versions. Run this procedure to create and deploy a new Lab Manager configuration and create resources for machines in the new configuration.
The plugin will set properties on the ElectricFlow server using the values from "Results location" and "Provision tag". Users can set the location where they want properties to be stored by specifying the "Results location" field, if this field is blank, the default location in the job is used: /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs. When this procedure is executed, properties will be stored in "Results location"/"Provision tag". If "Create resources?" is checked, the resources will use the "Commander Workspace" and will be assigned to "Resource Pool(s)", If it is unchecked "Resource Pool(s)" and "Commander Workspace" will be ignored.
IMPORTANT: This procedure is intended to run on Lab Manager 4.0 or later.

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration. (Required)
The name of the Organization in LabManager. This must reference an existing Organization in Lab Manager.
The workspace within Lab Manager (required in Lab Manager 4.0 and newer). This must reference an existing Workspace in Lab Manager (default is Main).
A configuration in the Lab Manager library. Provide the name of an existing configuration. (Required)
The name to use for the newly checked out configuration. If blank a name will be automatically created.
List of VMs to deploy. VM names must be separated by semicolons (;). Blank means that all VMs will be deployed.
Set the state of the configuration to public or private.
Name or ID of the physical network to be used.

Network deployment option for VMs.(Required)
Options:
None
Fenced - Block IN and OUT
Fenced - Allow OUT
Fenced - Allow IN and OUT
Bridged
Create resources for machines in the configuration. If checked, this creates the resource on the ElectricFlow server. (Required)
The ElectricFlow workspace the resource should use.
The ElectricFlow resource pool names to be associated with the machines in this configuration if resources are created.
The ElectricFlow location to store properties (default is /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs).
The unique tag for this provision to keep it separate from other provisions stored in the same results area (default is $[jobStepId]). (Required)
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.

div.p:
This procedure allows users to clean up a configuration using the VMWare LabManager API. It verifies if the configuration to be cleaned up is already undeployed before shutting down machines, shutting down the configuration and undeploying the configuration to avoid errors. Existing Commander resources associated with VMs in the configuration that are cleaned up will be deleted.
If "Configuration" is set the procedure will get its information and will undeploy and delete its associated resources, if this parameter is empty the procedure will get the provision results from "Deployed Results location"/"Deployed tag" for a configuration to cleanup. If the "Deployed Results location" field is blank, the default location in the job is used: /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs.
The plugin will set properties on the ElectricFlow server using the values from "Results location" and "Results tag". Users can set the location where they want properties to be stored by specifying the "Results location" field, if this field is blank, the default location in the job is used: /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs. When this procedure is executed, properties will be stored in "Results location"/"Results tag".
"Save Configuration owner" will be ignored if a value for "Save Configuration name" is not provided.

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration. (Required)
The name of the Organization in LabManager. This must reference an existing Organization in Lab Manager. (Required)
The workspace within Lab Manager (required in Lab Manager 4.0 and newer). This must reference an existing Workspace in Lab Manager (default is Main).
A configuration in the Lab Manager library. Provide the name of an existing configuration.
New library name for the captured configuration. If blank the configuration won't be captured to the library.
Name of the saved configuration. If blank the configuration won't be saved.
Username of the new owner of the saved configuration. If blank the owner is not changed.
The ElectricFlow location to get properties (default is /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs).
Tag to get the deployed configuration. (Required)
The ElectricFlow location to store resulting configuration properties (default is /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs).
The unique tag for this operation to keep it separate from other operations stored in the same results area.(default is $[jobStepId])
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.

div.p: This procedure allows the user to undeploy and clean up multiple configurations which owns, specifying the age (number of days) and a name pattern.

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration. (Required)
The name of the Organization in LabManager. This must reference an existing Organization in Lab Manager. (Required)
The workspace within Lab Manager (required in Lab Manager 4.0 and newer). This must reference an existing Workspace in Lab Manager (default is Main).
The number of days old. If blank all configurations for the given user will be cleaned up.
Delete configurations. If not checked, just undeploy; otherwise undeploy and delete.
Name pattern. If specified, only configurations matching the pattern will be cleaned up. If blank all configurations will be cleaned up.
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.

div.p:
This procedure captures a workspace configuration and saves it to a specified Lab Manager datastore.
If "Configuration" is set the procedure will capture it, if this parameter is empty the procedure will search for a configuration at "Deployed Results location"/"Deployed tag". If the "Deployed Results location" field is blank, the default location in the job is used: /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs.
The plugin will set properties on the ElectricFlow server using the values from "Results location" and "Results tag". Users can set the location where they want properties to be stored by specifying the "Results location" field, if this field is blank, the default location in the job is used: /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs. When this procedure is executed, properties will be stored in "Results location"/"Results tag".

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration. (Required)
The name of the Organization in LabManager. This must reference an existing Organization in Lab Manager. (Required)
The workspace within Lab Manager (required in Lab Manager 4.0 and newer). This must reference an existing Workspace in Lab Manager (default is Main).
A configuration in the Lab Manager library. Provide the name of an existing configuration.
New library name for the captured configuration. (Required)
The ElectricFlow location to get properties (default is /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs).
Tag to get the deployed configuration. (Required)
The ElectricFlow location to store resulting configuration properties (default is /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs).
The unique tag for this operation to keep it separate from other operations stored in the same results area (default is $[jobStepId]). (Required)
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.

div.p:
This procedure allows the user to clone a workspace configuration, save it in a datastore, and make it visible in the workspace under the new name, with the option of specifying the owner of the new configuration.
The plugin will set properties on the ElectricFlow server using the values from "Results location" and "Results tag". Users can set the location where they want properties to be stored by specifying the "Results location" field, if this field is blank, the default location in the job is used: /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs. When this procedure is executed, properties will be stored in "Results location"/"Results tag".

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration. (Required)
The name of the Organization in LabManager. This must reference an existing Organization in Lab Manager. (Required)
The workspace within Lab Manager (required in Lab Manager 4.0 and newer). This must reference an existing Workspace in Lab Manager (default is Main).
The name of the configuration to be cloned. Provide the name of an existing configuration. (Required)
The name of the new configuration. (Required)
Username of the new owner of the created configuration. If blank the owner is not changed.
The ElectricFlow location to store resulting configuration properties (default is /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs).
The unique tag for this operation to keep it separate from other operations stored in the same results area (default is $[JobStepId]). (Required)
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.

div.p: This procedure allows users to run any LabManager API command.

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration. (Required)
The name of the Organization in LabManager. This must reference an existing Organization in Lab Manager.
The workspace within Lab Manager (required in Lab Manager 4.0 and newer). This must reference an existing Workspace in Lab Manager (default is Main).
Enter each argument as name=value with multiple arguments separated by spaces.
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.

div.p: This procedure allows the user to change the owner of the given configuration.

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration. (Required)
The name of the Organization in LabManager. This must reference an existing Organization in Lab Manager. (Required)
The workspace within Lab Manager (required in Lab Manager 4.0 and newer). This must reference an existing Workspace in Lab Manager (default is Main).
Id of the configuration whose owner will be changed.(Required)
Id of the new configuration owner. (Required)
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.

div.p:
This procedure allows the user to provision a configuration from a VM template. First, the configuration is created. Then, one or more VMs are added to the configuration. Finally, the configuration is deployed and powered on, it is set to public or private, and the resources are created.
The plugin will set properties on the ElectricFlow server using the values from "Results location" and "Provision tag". Users can set the location where they want properties to be stored by specifying the "Results location" field, if this field is blank, the default location in the job is used: /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs. When this procedure is executed, properties will be stored in "Results location"/"Provision tag". If "Create resources?" is checked, the resources will use the "Commander Workspace" and will be assigned to "Resource Pool(s)", If it is unchecked "Resource Pool(s)" and "Commander Workspace" will be ignored.
IMPORTANT: This procedure is intended to run on Lab Manager 3.5 or earlier ONLY. See procedure: CreateConfigurationFromVMTemplate4.0

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration. (Required)
The name of the Organization in LabManager. This must reference an existing Organization in Lab Manager.
The workspace within Lab Manager (required in Lab Manager 4.0 and newer). This must reference an existing Workspace in Lab Manager (default is Main).
List of VM templates to add to the configuration. Template names must be separated by semicolons (;). (Required)
List of names of the VMs added to the configuration. VM names must be separated by semicolons (;).
List of boot sequence order values for the VMs. Values must be separated by semicolons (;).
List of boot delay values for the VMs. Values must be separated by semicolons (;).
Set the state of the configuration to public or private.
Name or ID of the physical network to be used.

Network deployment option for VMs. (Required)
Options:
None
Fenced - Block IN and OUT
Fenced - Allow OUT
Fenced - Allow IN and OUT
Bridged
Create resources for machines in the configuration. If checked, this creates the resource on the ElectricFlow server.
The ElectricFlow workspace the resource should use.
The ElectricFlow resource pool names to be associated with the machines in this configuration if resources are created.
The ElectricFlow location to store resulting configuration properties (default is /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs).
The unique tag for this operation to keep it separate from other operations stored in the same results area (default is $[JobStepId]). (Required)
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.

div.p:
This procedure has the same functionality as the CreateConfigurationFromVMTemplate procedure, but CreateConfigurationFromVMTemplate4.0 also allows you to specify the fence policy, deployment lease, and storage lease; as well as a subset of VMs to deploy. Because these features were implemented in Lab Manager 4.0, this procedure is not available for previous Lab Manager versions.
The plugin will set properties on the ElectricFlow server using the values from "Results location" and "Provision tag". Users can set the location where they want properties to be stored by specifying the "Results location" field, if this field is blank, the default location in the job is used: /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs. When this procedure is executed, properties will be stored in "Results location"/"Provision tag". If "Create resources?" is checked, the resources will use the "Commander Workspace" and will be assigned to "Resource Pool(s)", If it is unchecked "Resource Pool(s)" and "Commander Workspace" will be ignored.
IMPORTANT: This procedure is intended to run on Lab Manager 4.0 or later.

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration. (Required)
The name of the Organization in LabManager. This must reference an existing Organization in Lab Manager.
The workspace within Lab Manager (required in Lab Manager 4.0 and newer). This must reference an existing Workspace in Lab Manager (default is Main).
List of VM templates to add to the configuration. Template names must be separated by semicolons (;). (Required)
List of names of the VMs added to the configuration. VM names must be separated by semicolons (;).
List of boot sequence order values for the VMs. Values must be separated by semicolons (;).
List of boot delay values for the VMs. Values must be separated by semicolons (;).
Fence policy enum for the configuration: NotSpecified for either fenced or unfenced. True for fenced only. False for unfenced only. (Required)
Deployment lease in milliseconds. Pass 0 for Never Expires. Max allowed value is one year. (Required)
Storage lease in milliseconds. Pass 0 for Never Expires. Max allowed value is one year. (Required)
List of VMs to deploy. VM names must be separated by semicolons (;). Blank means that all VMs will be deployed.
Set the state of the configuration to public or private.
Name or ID of the physical network to be used.

Network deployment option for VMs. (Required)
Options:
None
Fenced - Block IN and OUT
Fenced - Allow OUT
Fenced - Allow IN and OUT
Bridged
Create resources for machines in the configuration. If checked, this creates the resource on the ElectricFlow server.
The ElectricFlow workspace the resource should use.
The ElectricFlow resource pool names to be associated with the machines in this configuration if resources are created.
The ElectricFlow location to store resulting configuration properties (default is /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs).
The unique tag for this operation to keep it separate from other operations stored in the same results area (default is $[JobStepId]). (Required)
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.

div.p:
This procedure allows the user to create a resource for each virtual machine of a configuration or for specified virtual machines.
Created resources will use the "Commander Workspace" and will be assigned to "Resource Pool(s)", if "Commander Workspace" is blank, default workspace will be used, if "Resource Pool(s)" is blank, resources will be assigned to "EC-$[JobStepId]" pool.
The plugin will set properties on the ElectricFlow server using the values from "Results location" and "Results tag". Users can set the location where they want properties to be stored by specifying the "Results location" field, if this field is blank, the default location in the job is used: /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs. When this procedure is executed, properties will be stored in "Results location"/"Results tag".

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration. (Required)
The name of the Organization in LabManager. This must reference an existing Organization in Lab Manager.
The workspace within Lab Manager (required in Lab Manager 4.0 and newer). This must reference an existing Workspace in Lab Manager (default is Main).
The name of the configuration containing the virtual machines to create the resources from. (Required)
List of VMs to create resources from. VM names must be separated by semicolons (;). Blank means that resources will be created for all the VMs.
The ElectricFlow workspace the resource should use.
The ElectricFlow resource pool names to be associated with the machines in this configuration if resources are created.
The ElectricFlow location to store properties (default is /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs).
The unique tag for this operation to keep it separate from other operations stored in the same results area (default is $[jobStepId]). (Required)
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.

div.p: This procedure allows the user to deploy and start an existing configuration.

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration.(Required)
The name of the Organization in LabManager. This must reference an existing Organization in Lab Manager.
The workspace within Lab Manager (required in Lab Manager 4.0 and newer). This must reference an existing Workspace in Lab Manager (default is Main).
The name of the configuration to deploy. (Required)
Name or ID of the physical network to be used.

Network deployment option for VMs. (Required)
Options:
None
Fenced - Block IN and OUT
Fenced - Allow OUT
Fenced - Allow IN and OUT
Bridged
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.

div.p:
This procedure allows the user to save a configuration state at a specific point in time.
If "Configuration" is set the procedure will get its information and will take a snapshot for the given configuration, if this parameter is empty the procedure will get the provision results from "Deployed Results location"/"Deployed tag" for a configuration to use. If the "Deployed Results location" field is blank, the default location in the job is used: /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs.

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration. (Required)
The name of the Organization in LabManager. This must reference an existing Organization in Lab Manager. (Required)
The workspace within Lab Manager (required in Lab Manager 4.0 and newer). This must reference an existing Workspace in Lab Manager (default is Main).
A configuration in the Lab Manager library.
The ElectricFlow location to get properties (default is /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs).
Tag to get the deployed configuration. (Required)
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.

div.p:
This procedure allows the user to return the configuration to a snapshot state.
If "Configuration" is set the procedure will get its information and will revert the given configuration, if this parameter is empty the procedure will get the results from "Deployed Results location"/"Deployed tag" for a configuration to use. If the "Deployed Results location" field is blank, the default location in the job is used: /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs.

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration. (Required)
The name of the Organization in LabManager. This must reference an existing Organization in Lab Manager. (Required)
The workspace within Lab Manager (required in Lab Manager 4.0 and newer). This must reference an existing Workspace in Lab Manager (default is Main).
A configuration in the Lab Manager library.
The ElectricFlow location to get properties (default is /myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs).
Tag to get the deployed configuration.(Required)
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.

div.p: This procedure allows the plugin to work with CloudManager plugin, it calls Provision procedure and is intended to be run by CloudManager.

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration. (Required)
The name of the Organization in LabManager. This must reference an existing Organization in Lab Manager.
The workspace within Lab Manager (required in Lab Manager 4.0 and newer). This must reference an existing Workspace in Lab Manager (default is Main).
A configuration in the Lab Manager library. Provide the name of an existing configuration. (Required)
The name to use for the newly checked out configuration. If blank a name will be automatically created.
Set the state of the configuration to public or private.
Name or ID of the physical network to be used.

Network deployment option for VMs.(Required)
Options:
None
Fenced - Block IN and OUT
Fenced - Allow OUT
Fenced - Allow IN and OUT
Bridged
The ElectricFlow workspace the resource should use.
The unique tag for this provision to keep it separate from other provisions stored in the same results area (default is $[jobStepId]). (Required)
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.
The ElectricFlow resource pool names to be associated with the machines in this configuration if resources are created. (Required)

div.p: This procedure allows the plugin to work with CloudManager plugin, it calls Cleanup procedure and is intended to be run by CloudManager.

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration. (Required)
A list of deployments (previously created by CloudManagerGrow) to stop. (Required)

div.p: This procedure allows the plugin to work with CloudManager plugin, it verifies that instances it has recorded as "alive" are indeed still alive, is intended to be run by CloudManager.

tr.td: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for LabManager. This must reference a valid existing configuration. (Required)
A list of deployments (previously created by CloudManagerGrow) to check. (Required)

div.h2: Use Case 1: Provision, Consume & Cleanup Job
div.p: The most common use for this plugin is to create a virtual machine, then create an ElectricFlow resource assigned to this machine, use the resource to run some operations, and the delete the resource and the virtual machine. To accomplish these tasks you must:

ol.li: Create a Resource for this provision.

div.p:
Plugin configurations are created by going to the Electric Commander "Administration" tab, then to the "Plugins" sub-tab. On the right side of the line for the LabManager plugin, there is a "Configure" link which will open the Configuration page.
Create a new configuration by specifying the requested parameters:
Once the configuration is created, you can see it listed in "Lab Manager Configurations", and now you are able to provision a new VM.
Create a new Provision procedure, fill in the requested parameters with real values from your Labmanager server:
Make sure you selected "Create resources?" checkbox.
Create a new command step to use the created resource, in this example we will pick a resource from the pool and just add an ec-perl sleep to use it for 30 seconds

Now the resource has been used and is ready to be cleaned up, create a Cleanup step, fill in the requested parameters, in this example we will use "Deployed Results Location" to select the configuration to clean instead of provide a specific "Configuration":
Once the job finished, you can see properties stored in "Results Location".
Provision output:
Cleanup output:

ul.li: Fixed issue with configurations being cached for IE.
Renamed ElectricCommander to ElectricFlow.
Added the feature to Attempt connection on CreateConfiguration.
Fixed references in step picker.
Procedure name(s) were changed in the step picker section
Added Procedure CloudManagerSync
Fixed CloudManagerShrink.
Fixed Plugin configurations description in Help Page.
Fixed ACLs problem when reinstalling.
Added IMPORTANT information about LM versions.
Fixed Provision code copied on wrong step.
Deleted CloudManagerGrow And CloudManagerShrink from stepPicker.
Change Help page style
Added help link to each procedure.
Parameter Panel XML Cleanup.
Applied new help page template.
Added detailed Use Case.
Added CloudManager support.
Added CloudManagerGrow procedure.
Added CloudManagerShrink procedure.
Change XML parameters panel for all procedures.
Added new parameter soap_timeout to CreateConfiguration procedure.
Added new parameter debug to CreateConfiguration procedure.
Upgraded documentation (identified main functions, added sections for every procedure: What does this procedure do? and Why would you run it?
Reverted results location default to '/myJob/LabManager/deployed_configs'.
Added new parameter labmanager_config to Cleanup, Capture, Snapshot, and Revert procedures.
Plugin stores configuration information even if create resource option is not provided.
Fixed Provision4.0 procedure for LabManager 4.0.
Fixed Cleanup procedure(check if machine is started).
Cleanup steps marked run always.
Changed 'CreateConfiguration' procedure to 'CreateLMConnection'.
Changed 'DeleteConfiguration' procedure to 'DeleteLMConnection'.
Changed ec_visibility of 'CreateLMConnection' and 'DeleteLMConnection' to private.
Changed results location default to '/myWorkspace/LabManager/deployed_configs'.
Added the BulkCleanup procedure.
Added the Lab Manager workspace parameter (labmanager_work) to all steps.
Added the following procedures: Clone, CreateConfigurationFromVMTemplate, CreateConfigurationFromVMTemplate4.0, CreateResourcesFromConfiguration, Deploy, and Provision4.0.

In the Cleanup procedure:
Added the ability to delete the ElectricFlow resources associated with the VMs in configurations.
Dropped the requirement for configuration/VMs to be deployed.
Changed the 'save_configuration_owner' parameter to ask for the username of the new owner, instead of the user ID.
Added the option to capture the cleaned up configuration.
In the Provision procedure, added the ability to verify that the configuration ID is successfully saved in ElectricFlow properties.
Added a field to the Provision procedure to specify the physical network to use.
Fixed bugs.
Added an option to the Provision procedure to set configurations to public/private and changed auto-created resources names.
Added a field to the Cleanup procedure to set the owner of the saved configuration, wait to shut down machines before shutting down the configuration, and force-undeploy machines.
Added the timeout parameter to all steps.
Fixed bugs and changed parameters names in lmintegration.pl file.
Added the following procedures: Capture, ConfigurationChangeOwner, Revert, and Snapshot.
